cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to slow WNW today, turn N-NW tonight, then N-NE on Wednesday and accelerate across Florida’s Big Bend into the western Atlantic off the GA/SC coast, then race ENE well offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – interests in central/northern FL and southeast GA advised to monitor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through coastal GA/SC/NC, then out over the open Atlantic south of New England
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance keeps heaviest rain south of PA)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Sat with gusts generally below tropical-storm force (≤34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware River and upper Delaware Bay based on present track
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible this weekend as the system passes well offshore; totals generally <2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor navigation restrictions possible due to higher Delaware Bay tides and reduced visibility in rain, but significant operational disruption is not anticipated given current forecast.
